article_title: Tohono O'odham upsets The Gregory School
article_text:
The Gregory School won their first nine games this season (Photo courtesy: Max Preps)

The undefeated run for The Gregory School ended on Friday night.

The Hawks (9-1) Nick Rosquist scored a pedestrian 19 points as TGS fell to Tohono O’odham at home 50-48, ending their nine-game win streak to start the season.

Rosquist, a junior guard, entered the game averaging 31 points per game this season. He already has a pair of 40-point games this season (49 vs. Kearney Ray and 47 vs. Santa Rita).

Hawks sophomore forward Addison Mort is averaging 16 points and nine rebounds on the season.

The Gregory School, formally known as St. Gregory Prep and coached by Dr. Michelle Berry, is poised to make a run for the Division V state championship.

The school won back-to-back state 1A championships in 2008 and 2009 under former head coach Paul Baranowski, now at La Jolla High School in San Diego, California.

article_metadata.Description: The undefeated run for Eagles ended on Friday night with a 50-48 home loss at the hands of some other Eagles.
article_metadata.author: David Kelly
